args: Her first visit to the Halidom came while\nAlberius was out on an expedition. I had\nremained behind to watch over the castle.
What's that you're working on, Cleo?\nA drawing?
Oh, it's a portrait of Alberius. \nYou've really captured his essence!
You...can tell what it's supposed to be?
Of course. Your warm feelings shine\nthrough.
Adjutant Myriam! Come quickly!\nSomething's happened in the courtyard!
Hm. So this is the Halidom.\nNot too shabby.
Oh, do you live here?\nBut...you're not Alberius.
I'm Myriam, Alberius's adjutant. You are?
I am Brunhilda. Though perhaps you'd \nknow me better as the Flamewyrm.
I'm familiar. They say a powerful flame-\nwielding dragon lives on Mount Adolla.\nTo what do we owe the honor, Brunhilda?
The Dyrenell Empire has been making a\nmess of my territory as of late. They attack\ndragons on sight, you see.
Rumor has it that Alberius leads a\ngroup currently striking back against\nthose tyrants.
And so you want to join the fight?

Ding ding ding! If I have to pick them
off one by one, I'll never be rid of them.
Better to join hands—claws?—with a
larger force and deal a mightier blow.
Truly?! Your assistance would\nprove absolutely invaluable.
Well, don't celebrate just yet.\nI'll join you on one condition.
I've no desire to throw my weight behind\nweaklings. So fight me. Show me your\nstrength.
So if I'm going to face anyone among you,\nit needs to be the big boss man himself.\nGot it? Then get Alberius out here.
Apologies, but...he's out on an excursion.
I came all the way down from my volcano\nand he's not even here?
I'm sure you'd agree it's best to delay\nthis test of strength until Alberius returns.
Oh, so now I'm at some humanoid's\nbeck and call? No thanks!
Y'know what? I think I'm over this.\nI was curious what sort of person could\nearn Midgardsormr's fealty, but oh well.
Wait! You're just going to leave?\nWhat happened to joining up with us?
You snooze, you lose. Obviously.\nI'm bored now, and I can handle the\nEmpire by myself well enough.
What should we do? We would be remiss\nto lose out on the Flamewyrm's assistance.
YOU? Do you realize what you're saying?
Don't be foolish.\nYou're no dragonblood heir.
Indeed. I am as ordinary as they come.\nBut we can't let this opportunity slip away.
I'm not really interested in beating up on\nsome frail little human girl.
Give it a rest, would you?\nYou're writing your own epitaph here.
I am still Alberius's adjutant. He and\nI have fought many a battle together.\nDo not dismiss me so easily.
Not backing down, eh?\nI'm impressed. You've got guts.
Well, who am I to let such bravery\ngo unpunished? I'll play along.\nGo ahead, girl. Swing first.
Yeaaah, that's about what I expected.
We're finished here. You there, sylvan.\nTend to her wounds and—
Huh. Perhaps I held back a bit too much.\nHave it your way, then. It's your funeral.
Enough of this, Mym!\nYou're badly wounded!
You've barely scratched me.\nWhy won't you give up?
Reality check, missy: you can't beat ME!
Hmm, did I go a bit overboard?\nWell, at least that should be the end of it...
Cleo! I'm...in my quarters.\nSo I lost.
The Flamewyrm must have returned\nhome by now. What a shame.
I wanted to ask you something.\nJust who is this Alberius to you?
Why would you fight practically to the\ndeath for him?
Ridiculous. You're telling me you endured\nall that just hoping to curry his favor?
That's not why. In fact, I don't care if he\never even learns what I did.
I merely want to be of use to him, no\nmatter the method. Then I will be happy.
I've never heard such drivel. You have\nto be the dumbest human I've ever met.
But if I'm being honest?\nIt makes you pretty interesting.
I'll join your fight against the Empire.
But this doesn't mean I've approved of\nAlberius. I'm just in this to see whatever\ndumb thing you do next. Got it?

For what? Oh, by the way, your name
doesn't exactly roll off the tongue.
Your parents weren't the greatest
decision makers, hm?
Feel free to take a page out of Alberius's\nbook and call me Mym, then.
Is that a pet name or something?
Well, whatever. At least it's only one\nsyllable. I look forward to working\nwith you...Mym.
